headline: Nothing must happen to Sowore -Adegboruwa
summarized_story:
A Senior Advocate of Nigeria, Mr Ebun-Olu Adegboruwa, has warned that nothing must happen to #RevolutionNow activist, Omoyele Sowore.
The lawyer also noted that Sowore was exercising his fundamental rights by joining a rally to demand good governance and an end to insecurity.
From the live Facebook video that I personally monitored, I saw Mr. Sowore engaging some policemen on the illegality of locking up the Unity Fountain.
Sowore has been the target of criminal prosecution, on account of his non-violent campaign for good governance and accountability.
I urge the government to allow Mr. Sowore to be and not to deploy the instruments of state coercion against a single individual, all in the attempt to break and silence him.

headline: Sowore: Attempt to change govt before election treasonable – Keyamo
summarized_story:
Minister of State for Labour and Employment, Festus Keyamo, SAN, says any attempt to change the present government other than the ballot box is treasonable and no reasonable government will tolerate such an attempt.
Sowore was reportedly shot on Monday by a female police officer at the Unity Fountain in Abuja.
The politician, who is the convener of the #RevolutionNow and #BuhariMustGo campaigns, was preparing to hold a rally with some associates when the incident happened at the Unity Fountain in Abuja, on Monday.
Any attempt to change a government other than the ballot box or other constitutional means is treasonable no matter how it is packaged in some sentimental jargon.
Any shortcut outside these is an invitation to anarchy and no reasonable govt will tolerate it.”

headline: Delta 2023: APC’s Omo-Agege pledges better service delivery to Delta Ijaw
summarized_story:
Kindly Share This Story:By Chancel Sunday, BomadiDeputy Senate President and the lawmaker representing Delta Central Senatorial District, Ovie Omo-Agege, yesterday, visited Delta Ijaw at Bomadi, Delta State, in his bid to lead Delta state in 2023 with a pledge to provide better service delivery in Ijaw land.
In a consultative/interactive meeting with Ijaw APC leaders/stakeholders, who came from Burutu, Patani, Warri Southwest, Warri North, and Warri South council areas, they appealed to Omo-Agege for basic amenities in the area.
High Chief Michael Johnny and APC state financial secretary, Chief Theodore Ezonfade, who made the appeal, noted that Delta Ijaw had been neglected by the PDP-led state government in the provision of democracy dividends since 1999.
Omo-Agege, in his response, said: “whatever I will do, I will do for the Ijaw nation.
“We need your support because all of your demands can be achieved if only we’re in power in 2023.

headline: Insecurity: Presidency, govs, NASS have let Nigerians down -Kokori -
summarized_story:
Describing insecurity in the country as a national emergency, he urged the federal government to sit up and “be serious”.
If he does not act, then the national assembly will put him on the spot.
Fulani herdsmen don’t have license before they have their arms.
“There is nowhere in the world or any point in history where you don’t protect yourself .
The governors, National Assembly and the Presidency should be ashamed of themselves.

headline: We have no record of Sowore being shot in Abuja
summarized_story:
Kindly Share This Story:By Kingsley Omonobi – AbujaSays Protester arrested, professionally dispersedThe FCT Police Command has debunked the viral message in some sections of social media purporting that ‘Omoyele Sowere was shot by a female Assistant Commissioner of Police’ at the Unity Fountain.
A statement by ASP Yusuf Mariam, Public Relations Officer said, “Contrary to the speculation, Police Operatives professionally restored calm at the Unity Fountain following attempts by a group of protesters to incite a public disturbance.
“The protesters who went on the rampage were resisted by Police Operatives in order to prevent them from causing a breakdown of law and order.
“There is no record of such incident as at the time of this release.
“The Command enjoins residents to remain calm and law-abiding while reaffirming its commitment towards the protection of lives and property within the FCT.”Vanguard News NigeriaKindly Share This Story:

headline: N380 fuel price: Next level catastrophe (1)
summarized_story:
When the N380/litre fuel is introduced, we would have reached the Next Level of national catastrophe.
We are responsible for what will unfold from the minute the new fuel price is announced.
Yet, fuel subsidy, where and when it exists, amounts to government encouraging the people to live beyond their means.
“NGF mulls N380/litre fuel price.” – News Report, May 20, 2021.
I have received several calls from our readers wanting to know if indeed there is a subsidy to be removed; whether N380/litre fuel price should be acceptable and what would be the consequences of that quantum increase in fuel price.

headline: Omoyele Sowore allegedly shot by police in Abuja
summarized_story:
Kindly Share This Story:By Luminous Jannamike, AbujaPolice in Abuja, the nation’s capital, on Monday, allegedly shot the publisher of Saharareporters and former presidential candidate, Mr. Omoyele Sowore, who appeared to be locked out of the Unity Fountain ground, where a rally was billed to take place.
Footage from a live video of the incident showed the rights activists and his team chanting solidarity songs before pandemonium struck.
The video showed officers arriving at the scene, with a small crowd led by Sowore standing at the entrance of the Unity Fountain when shots were heard and he collapsed on the ground.
“Yes, Omoyele Sowore was shot.
He was at the Unity Fountain to mobilise Nigerians ahead of a grand protest against insecurity on June 12.

headline: Insecurity: Fayose describes Buhari as national mishap, Jonah in Nigeria’s boat
summarized_story:
Former Ekiti State Governor, Ayodele Fayose, has said that President Mohammadu Buhari is a national mishap and should be made to resign following a series of insecurity experienced in the country.
He also noted that nothing is wrong with Nigeria as a country and Nigerians as a people.
According to him, “Buhari is the Jonah in our boat Nigeria) and he ought to leave.”“Nothing is wrong with Nigeria as a country and Nigerians as a people.
“Buhari is the national mishap and the Jonah in our boat.
“This insecurity is one too many and painfully, Nigerians will have to endure till 2023.

headline: Courier services to get independent regulator
summarized_story:
The Nigerian Postal Service (NIPOST) has announced plans to set up an independent regulator for courier services.
NIPOST is the government agency that licenses, regulates and monitors courier and logistics services providers.
Franklin Alao, General Manager, Corporate Communications, in a statement said the current regulations give no room for exploitation.
Denying allegations of extortion, the spokesman confirmed that due to agitations for a separate regulator to provide level-playing ground for operators, the government has set machinery in motion.
Alao recalled that after engagement with stakeholders in December 2020 and March 2021, the Minister of Communications, Isa Pantami approved the reviewed Courier and Logistics (Regulations) Operations 2020.

headline: Many injured as explosion rocks Mile 3 market in Port Harcourt
summarized_story:
Many persons have sustained different degrees of injury after an explosion rocked parts of Mile 3 market in Port Harcourt, the Rivers State capital.
In the confusion that ensued, two persons were severely injured, while scores, mostly women, suffered various degrees of injuries.
Confirming the development, the spokesman of the Rivers State Police Command, SP.
Nnamdi Omoni, told newsmen that police operatives have been deployed to the scene of the incident to ascertain what happened.
He also stated that the injured persons have been rushed to a nearby hospital while no life was lost in the incident.

headline: Insecurity: Human rights activists protest in Ibadan [PHOTOS]
summarized_story:
Some human rights activists on Monday in Ibadan, the Oyo State capital, began peaceful protests kicking against rising insecurity in the country.
The human rights crusaders, led by a human rights lawyer, Comrade Femi Aborisade, noted that current occurrences in the country have shown that governance has totally collapsed in the country.
Aborisade addressed journalists during the peaceful protest, where the protesters marched to some major streets in Ibadan.
Speaking further, he maintained that the present occurrences in the country necessitated the peaceful protest which began in Ibadan on Monday.
That contract is that the government has a duty to provide welfare and security for the people.

headline: Gulak's death painful, must be probed further
summarized_story:
Former Rivers South-East Senator, Magnus Abe has condoled with the family of Ahmed Gulak and the people of Adamawa State.
Abe, in a statement described the death as shocking, most painful and a great loss to his relatives and the political class.
The former Rivers SSG said Gulak was a fine gentleman, and a consummate politician who created relationships across ethnic and party lines.
Abe advised security agencies to carry out further investigation in order to avoid speculations that will increase tension in the country.
“Our prayer is that God Almighty will grant the family the fortitude and strength to bear the irreparable loss”, he noted.

headline: UPDATED: Gunmen kill ex-Enugu judge
summarized_story:
By Damian Duruiheoma, EnuguUnidentified gunmen have killed a former judge of the Enugu State High Court, Justice Stanley Nnaji while he was driving in his Mercedes Benz Sport Utility Vehicle (SUV), in the Enugu metropolis.
Justice Nnaji was reportedly shot on the chest and robbed of his SUV.
ADVERTISEMENTThe assailants numbering three were seen in a viral video double-crossing the former judge along Ebeano Tunnel, Enugu on Sunday evening.
They dragged him out of his car, killed him and drove his car away.
According to the spokesman of the state police command, Daniel Ndukwe, the gunmen trailed and shot dead the victim and carted his car away around 5pm on Sunday.

headline: Security: Israeli officials to train NATFORCE officials
summarized_story:
By Robert EgbeThe National Taskforce on the Prohibition of Illegal Importation/Smuggling of Arms, Ammunitions, Light Weapons, Chemical Weapons, and Pipeline Vandalism (NATFORCE) on Monday said it had received Israeli experts that will train its management staff and operatives.
NATFORCE Director-General Dr Baba Mohammed said the Israelis, from “world-renowned international security trainer organisation” ETOS Company, arrived at NATFORCE head office last Thursday.
He explained that the ETOS Company would provide comprehensive training of the agency’s workforce and technology transfer, adding that this was in addition to NATFORCE’s local training arrangements.
ADVERTISEMENTREAD ALSO: Smugglers shipping weapons into Akwa IbomThe NATFORCE DG said ETOS Company can offer the agency’s management team and operatives the professional training they deserve.
ETOS, according to a statement by NATFORCE, is reputed to have trained several security establishments including the military within and beyond African shores.

headline: Buhari expresses outrage over murder of Gulak
summarized_story:
Agency ReporterPresident Muhammadu Buhari has expressed outrage and disgust over what he called “the heinous murder “of Adamawa politician Ahmed Gulak in Owerri by yet to be identified gunmen.
The President reacted on Sunday in a statement issued by his Senior Special Assistant on Media and Publicity, Malam Garba Shehu.
“I am repulsed by such premeditated and gruesome murder of Gulak by evil people who are determined to undermine the peace, unity and territorial integrity of our country.
ADVERTISEMENT“Let me warn, however, that nobody or group of people who engages in such despicable act should expect to go free.
‘’Buhari expressed deep condolences to the family of the deceased, the people and government of Adamawa, as well as Gulak’s friends and associates across the country.’’(NAN)

headline: Sowore reportedly teargassed during protest in Abuja
summarized_story:
By Alao AbiodunPublisher of Sahara Reporters and human rights activist Omoyele Sowore has been reportedly teargassed during a protest in Abuja.
ADVERTISEMENTOne of his lawyers, Inibehe Effiong alleged a female police officer teargassed Sowore at the Unity Fountain in Abuja during a protest on Monday morning.
“Omoyele Sowore has just been shot by a female police officer at the Unity Fountain in Abuja.
He is being taken to the hospital for treatment.”“The officer fired a teargas cannister directly at his right thigh.
Sowore was specifically targeted.”Sowore, in a terse post on his handle @YeleSowore, said: “Just been shit by a police officer, ACP Atine at the Unity Fountain in Abuja.

headline: Sowore not shot at Unity Fountain ― Police
summarized_story:
By Alao AbiodunThe Federal Capital Territory (FCT) Police Command has denied reports that social activist and publisher of Sahara Reporters, Omoyele Sowore was shot by a female Assistant Commissioner of Police’ at the Unity Fountain.
It dismissed the reports as false and fake news.
ADVERTISEMENTThe Nation had reported Sowore was tear gassed and not shot as widely reported in many media outfits.
Read Also: Sowore reportedly teargassed during protest in AbujaSpokesperson of the Command ASP Mariam Yusuf, in a statement, clarified: “Contrary to the speculation, Police operatives professionally restored calm at the Unity Fountain following attempts by a group of protesters to incite public disturbance.
“The protesters who went on the rampage were resisted by Police Operatives in order to prevent them from causing a breakdown of law and order.

headline: Michael Okpara centenary celebration holds in Abuja June 3
summarized_story:
The first posthumous and commemorative centenary anniversary in honour of Dr. Michael Iheonukara Okpara, first republic politician, nationalist and former premier of Eastern Region of Nigeria (1959 -1966) holds on Thursday, June 3 at Sheraton Hotels and Towers, Abuja.
The event will also feature the presentation of Okpara Leadership Prize to a number of personalities, two universities and their Vice Chancellors, namely Michael Okpara University of Agriculture, Umudike (MOUAU) in Abia State and the University of Nigeria, Nsukka (UNN).
The Centenary Organising Committee proffered reasons for presenting the Okpara Leadership Prize to the personalities.
The amiable Premier and nationalist, Dr. Okpara would have been 100 years old having been born on 25 December 1920.
Dr. Okpara was former member of Eastern Nigeria House of Assembly on the ticket of the National Council of Nigeria and the Cameroons (NCNC).

headline: Sit-at-home: Tension, fear grip South East
summarized_story:
Similarly, MASSOB leader, Uchenna Madu, yesterday, warned the Nigeria security agencies that their threats would not hold waters.
This came as the various police commands threatened to crush any form of procession or gathering relating to Biafra today.
Attendance in many churches was scanty due to fear, as many people assumed the sit-at-home started yesterday as it used to.
Similarly, a wave of uncertainty enveloped Enugu State, yesterday, ostensibly because of recent security threats.
His warning is coming on the heels of the sit-at-home order for today by members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB).

headline: COVID-19: Erring passengers risk jail or N500,000 fine
summarized_story:
By Doris ObinnaThe Lagos State Government has said that new Coronavirus Act of 2021 empowers Mr.
Governor to sanction erring individuals with fines of up to N500,000 and/or imprisonment of up to five years.
In a statement, yesterday, the commissioner said the state is going to follow to the letter laid sanctions by Lagos State House of Assembly, which is also implemented by the Attorney General of the state.
We have isolated 433 passengers in our various accredited hotels and facilities; 262 are in Isolation and 154 passengers have been discharged with a negative COVID-19 test.
“All absconders will also face the penalties of the coronavirus pandemic Law 2021 of Lagos State, including varying lengths of prison time up to one year and fines of up to N500,000.

headline: Tension in Imo as gunmen kill APC chieftain, Gulak
summarized_story:
From Stanley Uzoaru, George Onyejiuwa, Owerri, Sola Ojo, Kaduna and Juliana Taiwo-Obalonye, AbujaGunmen, alleged to be in military uniform, yesterday shot dead an All Progressives Congress (APC) chieftain, Ahmed Gulak, in Owerri, Imo State.
Following the assassination, Northern Youth Council of Nigeria (NYCN) has called on Governor Hope Uzodimma to immediately bring the killers to justice.
Imo State government must give an account of those who killed Gulak.
Buhari outraged, says resources’ll be deployed to fish out perpetratorsPresident Muhammadu Buhari has expressed outrage and disgust over “the heinous murder” of Gulak.
The state police command said the APC chieftain left his room at Protea Hotel, Owerri without informing the police and other security agencies in the state of his movement.

headline: South East senators, reps give IGP marching orders to fish out unknown gunmen
summarized_story:
From Fred Itua, AbujaSenators and members of the House of Representatives from the South East geopolitical zone, have urged the acting Inspector-General of Police (IGP), Usman Alkali, to fish out unknown gunmen carrying out killings in the region.
They said the IGP must unravel the actual identities of the unknown gunmen in the South East and bring them to justice.
They said the investigation has become necessary in the current circumstances as a result of the magnitude of recent attacks.
In a statement signed by chairman of the South East caucus, Ike Ekweremadu, Minority Leader, Enyinnaya Abaribe, among others, siad majority of Igbo are opposed to any form of violence in furtherance of any cause.
“We note the increasing agitation for restructuring of Nigeria and increasing separatist agitations across the country due to perceived and real issues of marginalisation.

headline: Omoyele Sowore Shot in Abuja
summarized_story:
By Olawale AjimotokanLeader of #RevolutionaryNow, Mr Omoyele Sowore, was this morning shot in Abuja by a Police woman.
Sowore was addressing some of his supporters at the Unity Fountain along Shehu Shagari Road when the incident happened.
The activist and a former Presidential candidate in the 2019 election was rushed to the hospital after he was shot in his upper limb.
Many of the people who gathered at the scene fled in different directions after the incident.
Human Rights lawyer, Mr Inibehe Effiong, who published the incident on his timeline, said it could not be ascertained whether Sowore was shot with a live or a stun bullet.

headline: Tension in South-east as Separatist Agitators Follow Boko Haram’s Tactics
summarized_story:
In Enugu State, the Separatists have attacked INEC offices, including Udenu LGA head office in Obollo Afor, state headquarters in Enugu and Igbo Eze South LGA headquarters.
Also, INEC offices attacked in Ebonyi State included the ones in Ezza North LGA, Ebonyi LGA and Izzi LGA.
In Anambra State, gunmen attacked the state headquarters of INEC in Awka, the state capital.
If you love Ebonyi State, bring money, come and put up one construction.
In most churches in the state, residents were advised to heed the order, if not for anything, for them to be safe.

headline: M’Belt, Southern Leaders Rally Support for Southern Presidency
summarized_story:
They also expressed concerns about the deteriorating security situation in the country and called on the federal government to impose a state of emergency in the sector.
The leaders stated that if the security situation is not dealt with and banditry stopped or contained, it would not be feasible to have proper elections in 2023.
The forum added that it is imperative to immediately restructure the country, considering the precarious prevailing atmosphere, before any further elections.
SMBLF, while condemning the federal government’s stance on the resolutions of Southern governors banning open grazing and restructuring, said cattle rearing remained a private business enterprise.
It called on the military authorities to thoroughly investigate the incident to ascertain the actual cause of the crash.

headline: NNPC Plans N126bn Deduction from June Remittance to FAAC
summarized_story:
NNPC stated that its overall crude oil lifting for both export and domestic in March 2021, recorded 29 per cent decrease relative to the 10.79Mbbls lifted in February 2021.
MCA is a financing agreement whereby the International Oil Companies (IOCs) advance loans to NNPC to invest in upstream projects.
On the analysis of receipts due in April, gross revenue from JV crude was N124.3 billion, JV gas was N26.1 billion, while N5.8 billion was received from miscellaneous sources, amounting to N156.3 billion.
After deduction of royalty, JV cost recovery, profit before tax and taxes, receipts from JV crude came down to N5.5 billion, while that of JV gas stood at N7.8 billion.
He said: “On the Dangote Refinery acquisition, it’s actually an ongoing negotiations that was disclosed by one of our executives.

headline: Hoodlums Set Ablaze Another INEC Office in Imo
summarized_story:
Chuks Okocha in AbujaThe Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) yesterday raised the alarm over the burning of its office in Njaba Local Government Area of Imo State.
The commission said so far, the total number of INEC offices attacked nationwide since 2019 has now risen to 42.
In a statement issued by the INEC National Commissioner in charge of Publicity and Voter Education, Festus Okoye, the commission said Resident Electoral Commissioner (REC) for Imo State, Professor Francis Ezeonu, reported that INEC office in Njaba LGA was set ablaze on May 30, 2021.
It is also the eighth INEC office to be attacked in Imo State since the 2019 general election.
“The total number of INEC offices attacked nationwide since 2019 has now risen to 42.

headline: BREAKING: Police Shoot Sowore During Protest Rally In Abuja, Rushed To The Hospital
summarized_story:
Armed policemen in Abuja have opened fire on human rights activist, Omoyele Sowore during a protest to demand an end to insecurity in the country.
Sowore was shot in the right side of the stomach towards the hip by gun-wielding policemen drafted to the Unity Fountain.
The police who had already been stationed at the fountain before the arrival of the activist and other protesters opened fire on the unarmed protesters.
Just been shit by a police officer, ACP Atine at the Unity Fountain in Abuja.
#BuhariMustGo pic.twitter.com/c9ui2UutXO — Omoyele Sowore (@YeleSowore) May 31, 2021Many people also sustained varying degrees of injury during the incident.

headline: EXCLUSIVE: Nigerian Air Force Jet Crash-lands In Akure, Covered Up By Military Authorities
summarized_story:
A Nigerian Air Force ATR 42 aircraft heading for Owerri, Imo State, to aid military operations in the South-East region, crash-landed in Akure, the Ondo State capital, SaharaReporters has gathered.
It was gathered that military authorities covered up the incident and failed to make it public to avoid national embarrassment.
But there was no casualty according to sources, which made it easier for the NAF authorities to be silent on the incident.
Nobody is talking about the two pilots on the Alpha Jet.
The Alpha Jet, a light attack jet and advanced jet trainer aircraft, has played a significant role in Nigeria’s counter-insurgency campaign in the North-East theatre of operation.

headline: EXCLUSIVE: Nigerian Air Force Jet Crash-lands In Akure, Covered Up By Military Authorities
summarized_story:
A Nigerian Air Force ATR 42 aircraft heading for Owerri, Imo State, to aid military operations in the South-East region, crash-landed in Akure, the Ondo State capital, SaharaReporters has gathered.
It was gathered that military authorities covered up the incident and failed to make it public to avoid national embarrassment.

headline: Protest Against Insecurity, Bad Governance Rocks Osun
summarized_story:
The major streets of Osogbo, Osun State have been occupied by civil society organisations protesting against insecurity and bad governance in Nigeria.
The protest is aimed at sensitising residents of the state to always stand against injustice and maladministration rather than dying in silence, according to the convener, Comrade Waheed Lawal.
Waheed noted that despite the human and natural resources the country is endowed with, poor leadership has put the country in the wrong direction leading to untold hardship for the masses.
SaharaReporters gathered that the protesters, who took off from the popular Freedom Park at Old Garage and marched through station road, urged shop owners around Fagbewesa junction to join the advocacy for better Nigeria.
See Also Insecurity Zamfara Youths Block Major Highway, Destroy Vehicles In Violent Protest See Also PHOTONEWS: Nigerians Stage Fresh Protest Against Incessant Insecurity, Demand End To Anti-People Policies

headline: Gunmen kill ex-Enugu high court judge
summarized_story:
Stanley Nnaji, a former judge of the Enugu state high court, has been shot dead by gunmen.
AdvertisementNnaji was killed on Sunday evening in Enugu while driving in a black Mercedes Benz SUV.
A video posted on Twitter by a witness showed how the assailants double-crossed the judge’s car, dragged him out and shot him.
AdvertisementConfirming the incident, Mohammed Ndatsu Aliyu, commissioner of police in the state, said he has ordered a manhunt for the gunmen.
Nnaji was killed few hours after Ahmed Gulak, a chieftain of the All Progressives Congress (APC), was shot dead by gunmen in Imo state.

headline: Gunmen kill ex-Enugu high court judge

Stanley Nnaji, a former judge of the Enugu state high court, has been shot dead by gunmen.

Nnaji was killed few hours after Ahmed Gulak, a chieftain of the All Progressives Congress (APC), was shot dead by gunmen in Imo state.

headline: Niger governor travels abroad — hours after abduction of schoolchildren
summarized_story:
Abubakar Bello, governor of Niger state, has travelled out of the country.
AdvertisementThe development comes less than 24 hours after bandits abducted some schoolchildren from Salihu Tanko Islamic School in Rafi LGA of Niger state.
AdvertisementThe incident is the second in the state this year and among the series of abductions of schoolchildren by bandits in the northern part of the country.
They had abducted dozens of children from Government Science College (GSC) Kagara and released them a few weeks after.
In a statement on Monday, Mary Noel-Berje, chief press secretary to Bello, said the governor assured the state of the rescue and safe return of the students.

headline: Sowore injured by police teargas canister, says aide
summarized_story:
Omoyele Sowore, an activist, was hit by a teargas cannister fired by the police in Abuja on Monday, his aide has told TheCable.
AdvertisementSowore was said to have been shot at by the police at the Unity Fountain while he was trying to gain entrance into the place.
Sowore was said to have been speaking with a detachment of police officers stationed at the public facility when an officer shot at the crowd.
AdvertisementSowore has been having a brush with law enforcement agents since 2020 when he was arrested and detained for months by the Department of State Services (DSS).
He had called for a nationwide protest but was arrested on the eve of the demonstration in August 2020.

headline: Almentor’s online learning platform for Africa and the Middle East gets $6.5m backing from Partech, Sawari and Sango Capital
summarized_story:
Almentor, a video-based online learning platform for the Middle East and North Africa, has raised $6.5m in a Series B round led by Partech from its Africa Fund.
How Almentor worksFrom gamified mobile apps to websites that enable streaming, online learning comes in different varieties across the world.
Almentor can be accessed in multiple countries across Africa but the content is focused on North Africa and the Middle East.
In 2019, Almentor’s $4.5 million Series A was led by Sawari Ventures, an Egyptian firm that closed a $71 million fund in April.
Sawari also invested in this Series B round as Sango Capital, a firm based in South Africa.

headline: Bezos Expeditions invests again as Chipper Cash raises $100 million in Series C round
summarized_story:
Barely seven months after a $30 million funding round in which Jeff Bezos participated, Chipper Cash has raised $100 million in a Series C round.
Existing Chipper Cash investors like Deciens Capital, Ribbit Capital, Bezos Expeditions and 500 Startups participated.
Chipper Cash enables individuals to transfer money at zero fees between African countries.
Segunjogi’s comment suggests that Chipper Cash may also now be worth over $1bn, even if they have raised $80m less than the Nigerian fintech.
Like Flutterwave, Chipper Cash is headquartered in San Francisco but has over 200 employees working out of Africa and serving African customers.

headline: The Next Wave: Nigeria and other real-time payments leaders
summarized_story:
Another space where Nigeria’s example may influence the global space is real-time payments, as we’ll see shortly after a message from our partners.
India’s real-time payments revolution started in 2016 when the Unified Payments Interface (UPI) was launched.
But before all this, Nigeria made a similar historic move with NIBSS Instant Payments (NIP) in 2011.
NIBSS (Nigeria Interbank Settlement Scheme, a company co-owned by banks in Nigeria) built E-bills Pay on the NIP platform to enable account-to-account payments.
It is already being called “NIBSS for fintechs.”The upshot: Nigeria does not have India or China’s population to top real-time payments lists.

headline: National Identity Management Commission Appoints Spectranet 4G for NIN Enrollment
summarized_story:
National Identity Management Commission has appointed Spectranet 4G LTE owned exclusive shops as locations for Nigerians to register for National Identity Number (NIN)Disclosing this in a chat with the media, the Chief Executive Officer of Spectranet Ajay Awasthi said, 7 locations of Spectranet shops in Lagos, Abuja, Port Harcourt and Ibadan have been granted approvals to conduct registration of National Identity Number.
According to Ajay, these locations are already in operation with added manpower to attend to the need of anyone desirous of enrolling for the National identity Number.
It is a service we are offering for both Spectranet customers and other members of the public that are yet to register for the National Identity Number.
About Spectranet 4G LTE:Spectranet Limited was the first Internet Service Provider (ISP) to launch 4G LTE internet service in Nigeria.
Spectranet 4G LTE is a recipient of multiple awards for Best Internet Service and 4G LTE Provider in Nigeria in 2016, 2017,2018,2019 and 2020.

headline: HERITAGE BANK LAUNCHES SANDBOX TO ACCELERATE TECHNOLOGY INNOVATION IN NIGERIA
summarized_story:
Heritage Bank Plc, Nigeria’s innovative banking service provider has launched its robust innovation sandbox to accelerate innovation and help technology entrepreneurs build faster and better products.
The Bank’s Divisional Head Innovation & Partnerships, Ikenna Imo, while speaking on the initiative disclosed the Bank’s resolve to sustain its support and partnerships with innovative start-ups and tech entrepreneurs within Nigeria.
This, we believe will optimize the huge potentials inherent amongst tech enthusiasts and contribute immensely to Nigeria’s economic growth and job creation.
He mentioned also that in addition to the sandbox, the Bank has created a developer’s community (www.hbng.com/engage) to afford like-minded interactions between technology enthusiasts seeking to differentiate Nigeria within Africa and place our country on the world map of exceptional innovators.
Interested innovators, developers, and other technology enthusiasts can access the sandbox via https://sandbox.hbng.com/

headline: How to get free (and effective) press for your startup
summarized_story:
At our last edition of Techpoint Startup School, I taught a class on getting free press for your startup.
Lesson 1: Do you even need press?
You need marketing in the early stage because you need traction which you can use to get press.
If you just changed the logo of your startup, don’t expect the publication to announce that.
A better approach to get free press is to find a journalist who has shown interest in the intricacies of UI and design.

headline: It might get harder for budding African creators to make money with YouTube’s new terms of service
summarized_story:
Google-owned video-sharing platform, YouTube, released an update to its terms of service in November 2020.
The update revealed that taxes will now be levied on the royalties of content creators resident in the US, who are already entitled to payments on the platform.
This will soon take place in other countries as the new terms of service are rolled out.
The YPP was launched in December 2007 as a means of revenue generation for creators, who allow ads to appear on their videos for an amount of money.
The new policy puts some creators on the platform at a disadvantage, especially those still looking to grow their channels.

headline: News
summarized_story: Going by an update to @YouTube terms of service, from June 1 2021, creators outside the US that are not on the YouTube Partner Program (YPP) might now have ads appear on their videos with no entitleme…

headline: African cross-border payments startup, Chipper Cash, raises $100m, reportedly valued at over $1 billion
summarized_story:
African cross-border payments startup, Chipper Cash has raised a $100 million Series C led by US-based Venture Capital (VC) firm, SVB Capital.
It is, perhaps, noteworthy that Chipper Cash has raised up to $152 million in just two years.
While he doesn’t exactly confirm the startup’s unicorn status, Serunjogi tells TechCrunch that Chipper Cash is likely the most valuable private startup in Africa.
Nonetheless, Chipper Cash is playing in the cross-border payments space that has been historically difficult to crack.
AdvertisementOn the bright side, Chipper Cash joins the ranks of Jumia, Fawry, Interswitch and Flutterwave as African unicorns in record time.

headline: Nigeria’s NAFEX adoption may be long walk from full unification -
summarized_story:
Issues around liquidity and restriction on dollar deposits and usage are bigger challenges to full unification than merely recognising an overdue update on the CBN website, analysts said.
Read Also: BDCs tell public to patronize CBN-licenced operatorsNigeria, unlike it African peers has continued to operate multiple exchange rate window.
According to him, if the market is liberalised the naira will settle at its true value, which is higher than the current NAFEX rate.
Data collated from the black market implies a gap of N83 between the now official NAFEX rate and the parallel market rate.
Although on the rise, the falling global crude price always reduces FX supply in Nigeria and affect exchange rate like in 2020 and 2016.

headline: You have your customer’s attention, here’s how to use it
summarized_story:
You have your customer’s attention, here’s how to use itCreating value, engaging with customers and understanding data are key ways experts have said brands can keep customers attention in a hugely competitive business world.
At the conference, marketing experts reiterated the need to deploy data optimization, innovation and engaging content to achieve impactful marketing objectives for brands post pandemic.
The results showed the average person’s attention span was 12 seconds.
Sandra Amachree, senior media & brand PR manager, Nigerian Breweries, said companies need to see this as an opportunity to share their values with their consumers.
Ladipo also emphasized that it is important for organisations to understand data and tell the story to stakeholders.

headline: Nigeria’s air traffic controllers work in deplorable conditions
summarized_story:
Air Traffic Controllers (ATC) have decried the deplorable conditions at the airport control towers across the nation’s airports including Katsina, Kano, Sokoto and Calabar among other aerodromes saying that no airport in the country has up to 80 percent functioning equipmentThis is as they revealed that Kaduna airport has no control tower to navigate the airlines.
They disclosed that the country needs no fewer than 650 controllers nationwide to meet the needs of existing and new airports popping up.
No airport has all the needed equipment.”Also speaking, deputy vice president NATCA, Ahmed Adamu Bello expressed dismay at the working conditions in Katsina airport.
For Katsina airport, Bello said there was no system to answer nature’s call unless the ATC left the building which would be a breach of professional ethics.
He said Kaduna for instance has less than six ATCs yet NAMA has close to 4,000 staff.

headline: Delta Governorship race: Zoning not throwing up best candidate – Nigerian Observer
summarized_story:
Share FacebookTwitterStumbleuponLinkedInPinterestAbuja – The Centre for Research and Democratic Governance has expressed worry that the continuous zoning of the governorship seat in the Delta state is not paving the way for the best candidate to emerge.
“The very idea of zoning in Delta State therefore conflicts with its known assumed characterisation, as its content is attuned to the realisation of the objectives of a single individual.
“It is never designed as a consensus of vested stakeholders who are equally more concerned for an upward mobile development of personnel and infrastructures of Delta State with Asaba as capital.
He frowned at the situation where an ethnic group would continue to preach marginalization where such does not exist.
Ifeanyi Okowa never emerged as a product of a 2015 PDP zoning as clamoured in some quarters.

headline: UEFA president says Super League “rebels have paralysed themselves” – Nigerian Observer
summarized_story:
Share FacebookTwitterStumbleuponLinkedInPinterestBerlin – UEFA president Aleksander Ceferin says Juventus, Real Madrid and FC Barcelona have “paralysed themselves” with their commitment to European Super League (ESL) plans.
“For me what is strange is that you publish you are still part of the Super League and then you send a letter applying to play in the UEFA Champions League.
“So, you are in Super League but play UEFA Champions League.
If they say Super League exists —— and nobody prevents them from playing European Super League, the three of you can play your Super League.
“But they say they want to play UEFA Champions League as well at the same time.

headline: West Africa leaders suspend Mali from region bloc over coup – Nigerian Observer
summarized_story:
Share FacebookTwitterStumbleuponLinkedInPinterestSuspensionBamako, May 31, 2021 (dpa/NAN) The West African regional bloc ECOWAS has suspended Mali’s membership after coup leader Assimi Goita proclaimed himself president of the crisis-wracked country.
The Economic Community of West African States announced the decision late Sunday following an emergency summit of regional leaders in Ghana.
Mali’s Constitutional Court officially handed over the reins of power to Colonel Goita, 38, on Friday evening.
The trigger for the coup was the military’s anger over a cabinet reshuffle that saw two senior military officers stripped of their positions.
Last August, those military officers were part of a coup that ousted President Ibrahim Boubacar Keita from office after nearly seven years.

headline: Cyberattacks: NITDA cautions against hacking group masquerading as USAID – Nigerian Observer
summarized_story:
Share FacebookTwitterStumbleuponLinkedInPinterestAbuja – The National Information Technology Development Agency (NITDA) has urged Nigerians to beware of a widespread malicious email campaign undertaken by a hacking group, Nobelium.
NITDA warned that the group is masquerading as the US Agency for International Development (USAID).
According to her, the group targets government organisations, Non-Government Organisations, think-tanks, the military, IT service providers, health, technology and telecommunications providers.
She further said people should run Endpoint Detection and Response (EDR) in block mode to enable antivirus to block malicious artifacts because the EDR in block mode works behind the scenes to remediate malicious artifacts that were detected post-breach.
“Enable network protection to prevent applications or users from accessing malicious domains and other malicious content on the Internet.

headline: Alleged $350,000 fraud: U.S. court sets date for Abidemi Rufai’s arraignment
summarized_story:
This development comes after a federal grand jury ratified the charges involving conspiracy, wire fraud and “aggravated identity theft”.
This newspaper reported that nine counts of wire fraud and five counts of aggravated identity theft were ratified by the grand jury against Mr Rufai.
He was said to have used the identities of more than 100 Washington residents to steal more than $350,000 in unemployment benefits from the Washington State Employment Security Department (ESD) during the COVID-19 pandemic last year.
The U.S. government on May 24 filed an emergency motion of stay release order before the United States District Court for the Western District of Washington at Tacoma.
Last Tuesday, the judge, Benjamin Settle, granted the government’s motion to stay the release of Mr Rufai as the U.S. uncovered more criminal activities involving the suspect.

headline: Web Story 19 Jan
summarized_story:
Night-grazing is banned with immediate effect.
Movement of cattle within cities and highways is prohibited Under-aged grazing of cattle is outlawed.
those who wish to carry on with their cattle-rearing business to register

headline: Streets, markets deserted in Southeast, Asaba over IPOB’s sit-at-home order
summarized_story:
Major markets and streets in Nigeria’s Southeast and Asaba, Delta State, South South, were deserted on Monday over a sit-at-home order issued by the Indigenous Peoples of Biafra (IPOB) in honour of those killed during the Nigeria-Biafra war.
In Abia State, streets were deserted and shops are under lock and key while in Anambra State, the situation is the same.
The inner streets were deserted with security men positioned at different locations.
Many businesses in Delta State capital, Asaba were also shut as residents comply with the sit-at-home order.
The expressway leading to the head bridge was completely deserted while businesses along the expressway were also shut.

headline: Sahara Reporters publisher Omoyele Sowore shot in Abuja
summarized_story:
OBINNA EZUGWUActivist and publisher of Sahara Reporters, a New York based online platform, Omoyele Sowore, was on Monday shot by police in Abuja.
Sowore was on Monday morning shot in the hip, towards the right side of the stomach reportedly by gun-wielding female police officer during a protest to demand an end to insecurity in the country.
In a tweet, Sowore identified his shooter as ACP Altine DanielJust been shit by a police officer, ACP Atine at the Unity Fountain in Abuja.
#BuhariMustGo pic.twitter.com/c9ui2UutXO — Omoyele Sowore (@YeleSowore) May 31, 2021He was said to have been speaking with a detachment of police officers stationed at the public facility when a police man shot at the crowd.
“We condemn reports that Omoyele Sowore, a journalist, and activist, was shot at by the police in Abuja this morning during peaceful protest at the Unity Fountain,” the rights group said in a statement via its twitter handle, @SERAPNigeria.

headline: South East NASS Caucus Decry Attacks, Killings in South East
summarized_story:
However, we are worried over recent developments in the South East, which has thrown the zone into violence and confusion.
We therefore condemn in its totality all forms of violence and killings under any guise.
We advise the security agencies to continue to show restraint in the discharge of its mission to restore peace in the Southeast.
Security operatives must remember, at all times, that the majority of Igbos are opposed to any form of violence in furtherance of any cause.
Sen. Ike Ekweremadu Enugu StateSen. Enyinnaya Abaribe Abia StateSen. Orji Uzor KaluAbia StateSen. Sam EgwuEbonyi StateSen. Theodore A. OrjiAbia StateSen. Onyewuchi EzenwaImo StateSen. Rochas A. OkorochaImo StateSen. Frank IbezimImo StateSen. Stella OduaAnambra StateSen. Uche EkwunifeAnambra StateSen. Ifeanyi UbaAnambra StateSen. Chimaroke NnamaniEnugu StateSen. Chukwuka UtaziEnugu StateSen. Obinna OgbaEbonyi StateSen Micheal NnachiEbonyi State

headline: Dwindling revenue: FG in dilemma over govs N408/litre petrol
summarized_story:
By AYOOLA OLAOLUWAThe Federal Government is in a dilemma on how to remove fuel subsidy without attracting a public outcry and stiff opposition from the labour.
In September 2020, goverment again pushed the pump price of petrol to N158 and N162, but met stiff opposition when it tried to effect another price hike in December of the same year .
With the attempt to remove subsidy stalled for over five months, government received a major boost when the Nigeria Governors Forum (NGF) recommended a petrol price of N408.5 per litre per litre.
The committee recommends PMS pump price increment from the current N162per litre to N408.5 per litre and (negotiations with organized labour unions).
Whatever the government resolves with the Labour, we are ready to accept provided the product is available nationwide.

headline: NDLEA Seizes Cash, Drugs Worth N90bn In 4 Months – Marwa
summarized_story:
General Mohamed Buba Marwa (rtd) said the agency has seized cash and drugs worth N90billion since his assumption of office four months ago.
Marwa stated this at a bi-monthly meeting and award ceremony of outstanding NDLEA officers in Abuja.
Speaking further, the chairman said the Murtala Muhammed International Airport, Lagos Command and the Ondo State command were the co-winners of the March and April best performing commands.
That informed the strategic decision, among others, to institute a bi-monthly assessment of Best Performing Command Award to motivate our officers and men.
It is heartwarming to know that the best performing command award this time around, has two commands as joint winners.

headline: NDLEA Seizes Cash, Drugs Worth N90bn In 4 Months – Marwa
summarized_story:
General Mohamed Buba Marwa (rtd) said the agency has seized cash and drugs worth N90billion since his assumption of office four months ago.

headline: JUST-IN: Police Deny Shooting Sowore
summarized_story:
The Nigeria Police Force said the convener of Revolution Now, Omoyele Sowere, was not shot by the police as reported in some sections of the media.
READ ALSO: SaharaReporters Publisher, Sowore, Injured By Police Teargas Shot“Contrary to the speculation, police operatives professionally restored calm at the unity fountain following attempts by a group of protesters to incite public disturbance.
The protesters who went on the rampage were resisted by police operatives in order to prevent them from causing a breakdown of law and order.
There is no record of such incident as at the time of this release.
“The command enjoins residents to remain calm and law-abiding while reaffirming its commitment towards the protection of lives and property within the FCT.”

“The command enjoins residents to remain calm and law-abiding while reaffirming its commitment towards the protection of lives and property within the FCT.”

headline: Decline In Birth Rates: China Allows Couples To Have Three Children
summarized_story:
China has announced that it will allow couples to have up to three children, after census data showed a steep decline in birth rates.
China scrapped its decades-old one-child policy in 2016, replacing it with a two-child limit which has failed to lead to a sustained upsurge in births.
The cost of raising children in cities has deterred many Chinese couples.
It will come with “supportive measures, which will be conducive to improving our country’s population structure, fulfilling the country’s strategy of actively coping with an ageing population and maintaining the advantage, endowment of human resources”, Xinhua said.
“If relaxing the birth policy was effective, the current two-child policy should have proven to be effective too,” Hao Zhou, a senior economist at Commerzbank, told Reuters.

headline: Explosion rocks Mile 3 market in Port Harcourt — Daily Times Nigeria
summarized_story:
After an explosion rocked areas of the Mile 3 market in Port Harcourt, the Rivers State capital, many people were injured to varying degrees.
The explosion happened at 6.20 a.m. in the dry fish part of the market, while vendors were bringing in their wares and others were getting ready to start for business.
Two people were seriously injured in the ensuing chaos, while scores of others, largely women, were harmed to varying degrees.
The spokesman for the Rivers State Police Command, SP.
Nnamdi Omoni, confirmed the development, telling reporters that police operatives have been dispatched to the scene of the event to determine what transpired.

headline: The trauma and burden of hostile policing — Daily Times Nigeria
summarized_story:
In February, I wrote a piece about the “Enemies within” in Igboland, where I criticised this new phenomenon of unknown gun men.
In the first quarter of 2021, the South-East trailed only the South-South, which had 20 policemen killed there, and 16 in the South-East.
From the viewpoint of a South-Easterner, the region, Nigeria’s tiniest by landmass, has been feeling under the pressure of excessive policing for years.
Let us for the sake of argument, assume that each of these incidents of bribery and extortion was done in ₦1,000 notes.
Better still, 64 incidents of extortion every minute over the course of three years.

headline: Former Senate President, Anyim mourns Gulak
summarized_story:
Former President of the Senate, Mr Anyim Pius Anyim, is mourning the late Alhaji Ahmed Gulak and has described his demise as “one death too many’’.
Anyim said a statement on Monday in Abuja that the news of the gruesome murder of Gulak, “his friend and colleague, knocked him down into distress’’.
The former Senate President added, “May 30, 2021, is no doubt the darkest Sunday of my life.
Ahmed Gulak knocked me down into distress and it took me till this morning of 31st May, 2021, to regain my senses from the shock.
Ahmed Gulak was my colleague in President Goodluck’s administration.

headline: Lagos -Ibadan rail: FG assures host communities of assistance
summarized_story:
The Federal Government has assured host communities adversely affected environmentally or otherwise by the construction of the Lagos-Ibadan rail modernisation project of assistance.
This is contained in a statement issued by he Director, Press and Public Relations of the Ministry of Transportation, Eric Orjiekwe in Abuja.
The News Agency of Nigeria (NAN) reports that the federal government in 2018, began construction of a 156.65km standard gauge rail line from Lagos to Ibadan.
To be built with an investment of around N458bn (1.5billion dollars) from the Nigerian and Chinese governments, the Lagos-Ibadan rail project will be developed by China Civil Engineering Construction (CCECC).
The Lagos-Ibadan line is the first part of a new 2,733km Lagos-Kano standard gauge line.

headline: Abuja rally: Sowore injured by tear gas canister
summarized_story:
Former presidential candidate and publisher of online news medium, SaharaReporters, Omoyele Sowore, has been injured by a tear gas canister fired by a police operative in Abuja.
Sowore was reportedly shot on Monday by a female police officer at the Unity Fountain in Abuja.
The politician was preparing to hold a rally with some associates when the incident happened at the Unity Fountain in Abuja, on Monday.
He tweeted: “@YeleSowore has just been shot by a female police officer at the Unity Fountain in Abuja.
I watched Sowore being shot live on Facebook.”But the FCT Police Command denied that Sowore was shot, saying there was no record of the incident.

headline: Keyamo to Sowore: Attempt to change govt before election treasonable
summarized_story:
Minister of State for Labour and Employment, Festus Keyamo, SAN, says any attempt to change the present government other than the ballot box is treasonable and no reasonable government will tolerate such an attempt.
Sowore was reportedly shot on Monday by a female police officer at the Unity Fountain in Abuja.
The politician, who is the convener of the #RevolutionNow and #BuhariMustGo campaigns, was preparing to hold a rally with some associates when the incident happened at the Unity Fountain in Abuja, on Monday.
Any attempt to change a government other than the ballot box or other constitutional means is treasonable no matter how it is packaged in some sentimental jargon.
Any shortcut outside these is an invitation to anarchy and no reasonable govt will tolerate it.” PunchShare this: TwitterFacebookLike this: Like Loading...

headline: Governor Sani Bello out of Nigeria as bandits rule Niger state
summarized_story:
Governor Abubakar Sani Bello of Niger is at present not in Nigeria as bandits increasingly turned his state into a playground.
The bandits latest acts were the attacks on several communities in Tegina, Wushishi and Batati.
The bandits capped their reign of impunity with the kidnapping of over 200 students of Tegina Islamiyya school on Sunday.
But in a shock disclosure, the chief press secretary to Governor Bello said the governor had left the country before the recent attacks on “a security mission”.
Niger state in central Nigeria has been, in recent times, been facing unrelenting attacks by bandits and terrorists, leading to displacement of thousands of people from their villages.

headline: Garba Shehu: Those who underrated Ganduje now regret it
summarized_story:
By Abbas BamalliAlhaji Garba Shehu, Senior Special Assistant on Media to President Muhammadu Buhari said those who underrated Kano State’s Gov.
Speaking at the opening of the 2021 Biennial Convention of the Nigerian Guild of Editors on Monday in Kano, Shehu said the state had recorded lots of development, commitments and reconciliation under Ganduje’s leadership“People should come and learn from Kano State,’’ Shehu said.
Shehu appealed to editors at the convention to continue to promote peace and unity through their media reportage.
“I think we should also use this opportunity to remind ourselves of our responsibility to improve on media roles.
“My appeal to my colleagues here is that let us see the country more in terms of a glass that is full rather than glass that is half empty,’’ Shehu said.

headline: ECOWAS suspends Mali, insists on Feb. 2022 election
summarized_story:
Agency ReportsEconomic Community of West African States (ECOWAS) has suspended Mali’s membership in response to last week’s coup by Colonel Assimi Goita.
In a communique after the summit, ECOWAS said Mali’s membership in the bloc was suspended with immediate effect.
Instead, ECOWAS said a new civilian prime minister should be nominated and a new inclusive government formed to proceed with the transition programme.
“The date of 27th February 2022 already announced for the presidential election should be absolutely maintained,” the leaders’ communique said.
He ordered the arrests last Monday of interim President Bah Ndaw and Prime Minister Moctar Ouane.

headline: BREAKING: Osun Residents Protest Over Insecurity, Bad Governance
summarized_story:
In Osun state, civil society organizations thronged major avenues in Osogbo, the state capital, to protest insecurity and poor administration in Nigeria.
According to the Convener, Comrade Waheed Lawal, the purpose of the demonstration is to raise awareness among inhabitants of the state about the need of speaking up against injustice and maladministration rather than dying in quiet.
The demonstrators marched from Old Garage’s popular Freedom Park to Station Road, where they spoke to store owners near Fagbewesa Junction on the importance of joining the fight for a better Nigeria.
Comrade Waheed Saka who spoke at the Fagbewesa junction said despite the human and natural resources the country is endowed with, poor leadership has put the country in the wrong direction leading to untold hardship among the masses.

headline: Sowore Was Not Shot At Unity Fountain – Police Spokesperson
summarized_story:
On Monday, the Federal Capital Territory Police Command disputed a viral post on social media claiming that ‘Omoyele Sowere was shot by a female Assistant Commissioner of Police’ near the Unity Fountain, calling it untrue and fake news.
This was contained in a statement made available to news men in Abuja by the Spokesperson of the Command ASP Mariam Yusuf.
According to her, “contrary to the speculation, Police Operatives professionally restored calm at the Unity Fountain following attempts by a group of protesters to incite public disturbance.
“The protesters who went on the ramapage were resisted by Police Operatives in order to prevent them from causing a breakdown of law and order.
There is no record of such incident as at the time of this release.”The Command enjoined residents to remain calm and law-abiding while reaffirming its commitment towards the protection of lives and property within the Federal Capital Territory.

headline: Sowore Speaks After Been Shot By Police Officer In Abuja
summarized_story:
The founder of Sahara Reporters, Omoyele Sowore has Spoken after he was reportedly been shot by a female police officer in Unity Of Fountain, Abuja.
In his tweet, he wrote: “Just been shit by a police officer, ACP Atine at the Unity Fountain in Abuja.
#RevolutionNow Let the struggle continue even if they take my life!
#BuhariMustGo”Just been shit by a police officer, ACP Atine at the Unity Fountain in Abuja.
#BuhariMustGo pic.twitter.com/c9ui2UutXO — Omoyele Sowore (@YeleSowore) May 31, 2021NEWS DIRECT Earlier gathered that he sustained gunshots injuries and has been rushed to hospital for medical treatment.

headline: Breaking: Again, JAMB extends 2021 UTME registration, tells candidates what to do before deadline
summarized_story:
Joint Admissions and Matriculation Board (JAMB) has given two given another two weeks extension to candidates to complete their registration for the 2021 Unified Tertiary Matriculation Examination (UTME).
The deadline for first registration extension was May 29, 2021.
This was disclosed in statement by JAMB’s head of information and protocol, Dr. Fabian Benjamin on Monday.
According to the statement, candidates yet to register have between May 31 and June 15 to complete their registration if they were not able to by last Saturday because of NIN verification issues using a new guideline.
The statement reads: “All prospective candidates with genuine proof(s) of failed efforts to register before the closing date, are to, between Monday May 31 and June 15, 2021, visit any of the Joint Admissions and Matriculation Board offices (including JAMB-owned professional test centres, PTCs) across the nation to:“(I) obtain at no cost and complete a form which is being made available to candidates with genuine reasons for missing the registration;“(ii) submit (for the reading test and application), a certified bank draft of N4,000 in favour of the Joint Admissions and Matriculation Board (and obtain a signed duplicate copy from the office);“(iii) submit the completed form with a recent passport photograph at the same office of collection;“(iv) collect a copy of the reading test;“(v) await further directives through the registered phone number and public service announcement as soon as the screening is completed.”Share this:TweetPrintTelegramWhatsApp

headline: VIDEO: How gunmen murdered ex-high court judge, Stanley Nnaji
summarized_story: NextBreaking: Again, JAMB extends 2021 UTME registration, tells candidates what to do before deadline

headline: Pictures: Another tragedy as gunmen kill ex-high court Judge
2023 elections: Group drums support for Osinbajo, Al-Mustapha aspiration -NigPilot
summarized_story:
The group said that the success of the duo in 2023 would lead to economic prosperity, job creation, and sustainable development.
The leader of the group said it was backing Osinbajo’s presidential ambition for 2023 and was also calling on others to queue behind the VP.
According to him, “Osinbajo and Al-Mustapha are vastly knowledgeable in the economy and security intelligence of rebuilding a better and United Nigeria.
“We have realized that youths and women in the country are vital to ensuring Osinbajo and Al-Mustapha ticket, hence, the need to reach out to them.
“For the APC, the unifying balm of Buhari will still play a vital role to salvage her mistakes and reposition a better Nigeria.

headline: North-East stakeholders demand creation of Savannah State -NigPilot
summarized_story:
In Bauchi centre, the people of Southern Borno comprising nine local government areas on Thursday disagreed with the position of the Borno State government and insisted on the creation of Savannah State.
“We the people of Askira/Uba, Bayo, Biu, Chibok, Damboa, Gwoza, Hawul, Kwaya-Kusar and Shani Local Government Areas of Borno State wish to present our request for the creation of Savannah State out of the present Borno State.
The 2014 Conference report has again clearly shown that SAVANNAH state met all necessary criteria for the creation of the state in Nigeria.
“The proposed Savannah State is richly endowed with Solid Minerals, agricultural products, tourism potentials and human resources that can be harnessed to lay a solid foundation for the transformation of the State.
“It is an incontrovertible fact that greater part of both the human and material resources of the present Borno state come from the southern part.

headline: Pan-Nigeria group commends Buhari’s choice of Farouk Yahaya as COAS -NigPilot
summarized_story:
Nigeria First, a pan-Nigeria group, has applauded President Muhammadu Buhari’s choice of Major General Farouk Yahaya as late Lt Gen Ibrahim Attahiru’s successor for the position of Chief of Army Staff.
According to the group, Maj Gen Yahaya’s appointment is another evidence of President Buhari’s commitment to the war against insurgency and insecurity across the nation.
Nigeria First, which made this known on Sunday at a press conference in Abuja, described the move as the right step in the right direction.
It also urged the new COAS to ensure that the Nigerian Army develops a versatile and proactive intelligence network that would greatly assist in nipping in the bid acts that undermine national security.
The group further tasked Yahaya to ensure that the Nigerian Army remains apolitical in its various operations across the country, and also put the interest of the country and the nation’s nascent democracy at the centre of all decision making.

headline: Insecurity: FCTA demolishes Fulani settlement, other illegal structures
summarized_story:
The Federal Capital Territory Administration FCTA, through its Joint Task Force JTF, has demolished a Fulani Ruga settlement located very close to Nnamdi Azikiwe International Airport, Abuja.
This was even as illegal structures and outright encroachment within both the Army and Police estates along the Airport road, as well as a drug market, popularly called ” car wash ” in Lugbe, were all demolished.
Attah said that the Airport road was a major gateway to the city centre of the nation’s capital, and therefore won’t be abandoned to lawlessness.
He added that two months notice had been given to the affected people, but no compliance was recorded.
Attah said, “two months ago the FCT Minister, Malam Muhammad Bello visited the in-bound and outbound of the Airport road with key stakeholders and showed us several contraventions.

headline: Businesses Shut, Streets Deserted In South-East Amid IPOB’s Sit-At-Home Order
summarized_story:
Businesses, schools, and other major economic hubs were shut.
In Abia State, streets were deserted and shops are under lock and key while in Anambra State, the situation is the same.
The inner streets were deserted with security men positioned at different locations.
Many businesses in Delta State capital, Asaba were also shut as residents comply with the sit-at-home order.
The expressway leading to the head bridge was completely deserted while businesses along the expressway were also shut.

headline: Zamfara Youths Block Highway, Destroy Vehicles In Violent Protest
summarized_story:
Angry youths armed with weapons have staged a violent protest along the Gusau – Kaura Namoda Highway in Zamfara State.
Eyewitnesses told Channels Television that the protesters occupied the road very early on Monday over the incessant attacks by bandits in their communities.
One of the commuters who was trapped along the road explained that the youths blocked the highway along Kurya junction and began to destroy public vehicles travelling along the road.
READ ALSO: How Bandits Attacked Five Zamfara Communities, Killed Over 20 People – WitnessesResidents of Zamfara have been living in fear as a result of the continued attacks by bandits on communities in various parts of the state.
Dosara noted that the Zamfara State government has spent the sum of N970 million on payment of ransom to bandits to secure the release of kidnapped victims since 2011.

headline: Police Kill Murderers Of Ahmed Gulak, Recover Ammunition And Vehicles
summarized_story:
The Imo State Police Command has neutralised the killers of a chieftain of the All Progressives Congress (APC), Ahmed Gulak, and recovered ammunition and vehicles from them.
“The assailants were said to have used a Toyota Camry 2005 model with silver color; Toyota Sienna 1998 Model with golden color; Toyota Hilux with white color; and a Lexus RX 330 with golden Color.
“Having established the identity of the assailants and the description of the vehicles used in carrying out the attack, the teams further got details of the direction the hoodlums have taken.
“Three out of the four vehicles used in attacking Gulak were recovered.”Gulak was killed around Umueze Obiangwu in Ngor-Okpala Local Government Area close to the Sam Mbakwe Airport road in Owerri, Imo State on Sunday morning.
Gulak was trailed from his hotel room to the spot where he was killed.

headline: At Least 200 Islamiyya Students Kidnapped In Niger
summarized_story:
At least 200 students of an Islamiyya school located at Tegina in Rafi Local Government Area of Niger State have been abducted.
Mohammed said the Salihu Tanko Islamiyya school where the incident took place, was built by a retired Immigration Officer.
DSP Abiodun said operatives are yet to ascertain how many children were abducted from the Salihu Tanko Islamic school.
The police spokesman called for calm, saying that the force in conjunction with other security agencies will do everything possible to ensure that the children are rescued unhurt.
He said though the simultaneous attacks were overwhelming for security agencies at the time, the government in collaboration with the security agencies has mobilized troops to the various locations, including local vigilantes.

headline: Reps Minority Caucus Condemns Killing Of Ahmed Gulak
summarized_story:
The minority caucus in the House of Representatives has condemned the killing of Mr Ahmed Gulak, a former political adviser to former President Goodluck Jonathan.
In a statement on Monday by the Minority Leader of the House, Ndudi Elumelu, the lawmakers described the killing of Gulak as wicked and barbaric.
“The minority caucus is heavily disturbed by the worsening insecurity, violence, and killings in Imo, particularly since the All Progressives Congress (APC) administration took over the state.
Gulak died on Sunday after gunmen attacked a cab conveying him and two others while on their way to the Sam Mbakwe Airport in Owerri, the Imo State capital.
He was reported to have left his hotel without informing the police and other security agencies in view of the fragile security situation in the South East.

headline: Delta State Police Command warns against hoisting/carrying of Biafra Flag
summarized_story:
The Delta State Police Command has stated that it is aware of the threat posed by the proscribed Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) and their intention to parade themselves in various parts of the state.
The Commissioner of Police Mohammed Ari Ali, has advised state command officers and soldiers to be on high alert, vigilant, and deal firmly with troublemakers.
In addition, Mr. Ali warns that no one in the state should be seen carrying or hoisting the Biafra flag in any form.
The Delta State Police Department is urging members of the public to work with them to ensure that those who attempt to sow discord in the state and our dear nation are apprehended and prosecuted.
He said Undercover Police detectives have been deployed across the state for the purpose of arresting any one caught carrying Biafra Flag and to ensure that they are dealt with accordance with the law of the land.

headline: Governor Sani Bello travels out of the country on Security Mission
summarized_story:
Governor of Niger State Abubakar Sani Bello has traveled out of the country on a security mission.
The Governor, who had left the country prior to the incident to explore all options for strengthening the state’s security architecture, is expected to return soon, this is according to a statement issued by Mary Noel- Berje, Chief Press Secretary to the governor.
The statement added that the Governor has directed security personnel and state government officials to do everything possible to ensure the safe return of the abducted Tegina Islamiyya children and others.
Sani Bello, who is expected back in the country within the shortest period of time, has assured the rescue and safe return of the children.
Mean while the Governor has directed that a situation room be re-activated to update the public.

headline: Nigeria: Kidnappers Free 11 Students ‘Too Small to Walk’
summarized_story:
Authorities in the northern Nigerian state of Niger say eleven children who were among the many abducted children from Salihu Tanko Islamic School have been released because they were “too small and couldn’t walk”.
There has been no official confirmation of the exact number of students kidnapped from the school in the town of Tegina, but its been alleged to be about 200 children.
In a statement, Sani Bello, the governor of Niger state expressed sadness at the news of the abduction, adding that the security situation in his state had reached crisis level.
The statement signed by Mary Noel-Berje, the chief press secretary to the Niger state governor said the bandits released the children “who were too small and couldn’t walk”.
“The situation has reached crisis level, in fact, it’s a war situation that we have to confront without further delay,” she quoted the governor as saying.

headline: Nigerian Activist Sowore Shot by Police, Senior Lawyer Falana Says
summarized_story:
Prominent Nigerian activist and publisher of Sahara Reporters, Omoyele Sowore has been shot by the police in the nation’s capital Abuja on Monday.
Human Rights lawyer Femi Falana confirmed the incident to ARISE News over the phone.
“Yes it is true, that’s the information reaching me.
He (Sowore) was shot by the police,” Falana a Senior Advocate of Nigeria said.
Reports however suggest he was shot by a police officer at the popular Unity Fountain in Abuja where they had converged at 8:30 am.

headline: China Allows Couples to Have Three Children
summarized_story:
China has announced that it will allow each couple to have up to three children, marking the end of a strict two-child policy.
According to state media outlet Xinhua, the change was approved by President Xi Jinping in a politburo meeting.
It comes after a once-in-a-decade census showed that China’s population grew at its slowest pace in decades.
This added pressure on Beijing to boost measures for couples to have more babies and avert a population decline.
It was widely expected after the census data results were released that China would relax its family policy rules.

headline: Israel Coalition Government a Threat to Security, Netanyahu Warns
summarized_story:
Israel’s Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has warned that a proposed new unity government would be “a danger for the security” of the country.
If they are successful, it would bring to an end the rule of the country’s longest serving prime minister.
Mr Netanyahu, who is on trial for fraud, fell short of a decisive majority at a general election in March.
“Mr Netanyahu is no longer trying to form a right-wing government because he knows full well that there isn’t one.
The proposed coalition would bring together factions from the right, the left and the centre of Israeli politics.

headline: Copa America Left without Hosts 13 Days from Start after Argentina Stripped of Rights
summarized_story:
The 2021 Copa America has been left without a host less than two weeks before it starts after Argentina was stripped of the tournament.
Argentina was originally set to co-host with Colombia, who were removed on 20 May after protests in the country.
The South American Football Confederation (Conmebol) said Argentina has been removed because of the “present circumstances”.
Conmebol said it was currently “analysing the offer of other countries” that showed interest in hosting the 10-team Copa America, which is scheduled to run from 13 June to 10 July.
Brazil are defending champions, having won the tournament in 2019.
